Description:
P/SPD220222/01-312295915
Persons are able to access the cutting blades when the guillotine is in use due to the lack of rear guarding because you have failed to take effective measures to prevent access to the dangerous parts of the guillotine or to stop the movement of dangerous parts before any part of a person enters a danger zone

P/SPD220222/02-312296094
Persons are liable to come into contact with dangerous parts of the machine, namely the rotary chuck when the machine is operating because you have failed to take effective measures, such as a suitable chuck guard, to prevent access to the dangerous parts when it is in use


P/SPD220222/03-312296413
Persons are able to access the rotating drill tip and spindle when the machine is operating because you have failed to take effective measures to stop the movement of dangerous parts, namely the rotating drill tip and spindle, before any part of a person enters the danger zone

IN/SPD210322/01-312369786
You have failed to appoint one or more competent person(s) to assist you in undertaking the measures 
required to comply with the requirements of; The Health and Safety at Work etc Act 1974 and the relevant statutory provisions made under the Act, having regard to the health and safety risks to which your employees are exposed. 

IN/SPD210322/02-312369841
You have failed to take effective measures to prevent access to dangerous parts of machinery in
that; you have failed to implement an effective check procedure to ensure that the guards and
protection devices provided for the machinery in your workshop, including the Pearson P49 metal cutting guillotine, lathe and radial arm drill, are maintained in an efficient state, efficient working order and good repair and, as a result safety critical parts of these machines are missing or defective.

 IN/SPD210322/03-312369848
Where adequate control of exposure to welding fume cannot be achieved by other means, you have failed to provide suitable personal protective equipment in that; the respiratory protective equipment provided to your employee undertaking metal inert gas (MIG) welding for pipework fabrication work and other tasks is not suitable for the duration of welding that is being carried out.

IN/SPD210322/04-312369855
You have failed to ensure that the exposure of your employees to the welding fume produced by the 
tungsten inert gas (TIG) welding on stainless steel undertaken in the fabrication workshop is either 
prevented or, where this is not reasonably practicable, adequately controlled, in that; you have failed to 
control exposure to welding fume at the source of production by adequate ventilation systems and 
appropriate organisational measures.
